pages.text: Herne, the Lord of the Wild Hunt, is commonly $(l:bewitchment:tools/grotesque_stew)Pledged$() to by suffering $(l:bewitchment:curses/lycanthropy)Lycanthropes$(). He can grant almost total control over the $(l:bewitchment:curses/conducting_curses)Curse$(), allowing victims to transform at will. Alternatively, he can be offered $(l:bewitchment:introduction/crops)Aconite$(), removing the $(l:bewitchment:curses/conducting_curses)Curse$() entirely.$(br2)Summoning him is rather elaborate, and will be outlined in this entry.

pages.title: Summoning Herne
pages.text: To summon Herne, several things are needed:$(li)a $(l:bewitchment:tools/brazier#mortal_coil)Mortal Coil Incense$()$(li)a Wolf $(li)a forest or taiga biome$(br2)First, start the $(l:bewitchment:tools/brazier#incense)Incense$() in the right biome, at night. Then you will need to slay a Wolf with an $(l:bewitchment:tools/athame)Athame$(), not too far away.

Choose the place for doing this wisely; you'll need to keep Herne around if you want to $(l:bewitchment:tools/grotesque_stew)Pledge$() to him.$(br2)Once $(l:bewitchment:tools/grotesque_stew)Pledged$(), you can toggle your wolf-form by pressing [$(k:bewitchment.transformation_ability)].
